dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, so, have you seen this news coming out of Kazakhstan? Like, something pretty cool might be happening.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, so, have you seen this news coming out of Kazakhstan? Like, something pretty cool might be happening.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, uh, no, I don't think so. What's going on over there? Another space launch?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, uh, no, I don't think so. What's going on over there? Another space launch?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Not quite! Apparently, they might be getting a brand-new national holiday. Like, officially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not quite! Apparently, they might be getting a brand-new national holiday. Like, officially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A new national holiday, Tulpar Day, may soon appear in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, a new national holiday? That's, um, a big deal. What's it gonna be called?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, a new national holiday? That's, um, a big deal. What's it gonna be called?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's called "Tulpar Day." And it all started with, you know, a parliamentary inquiry from the Mazhilis deputies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's called "Tulpar Day." And it all started with, you know, a parliamentary inquiry from the Mazhilis deputies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A new national holiday, Tulpar Day, may soon appear in Kazakhstan. This was stated in Prime Minister Olzhas Bektenov™s official response to a parliamentary inquiry from members of the Mazhilis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Tulpar Day, huh? Okay, I'm intrigued. What's the backstory? Why do they need *another* holiday?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tulpar Day, huh? Okay, I'm intrigued. What's the backstory? Why do they need another holiday?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it actually came from a group of deputies asking the government about developing horse breeding. They pointed out some issues, like, uh, low-quality horse meat imports, and no real systematic education for horse professions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it actually came from a group of deputies asking the government about developing horse breeding. They pointed out some issues, like, uh, low-quality horse meat imports, and no real systematic education for horse professions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The authors highlighted several industry issues, such as the import of low-quality horse meat, the lack of systematic education for horse-related professions, and the need to modernize racetracks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so it's about the horse industry? That actually makes a lot of sense, given Kazakhstan's history. So, they just said, "Hey, let's make a holiday"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so it's about the horse industry? That actually makes a lot of sense, given Kazakhstan's history. So, they just said, "Hey, let's make a holiday"?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! [overlaps] They also proposed five modern equestrian complexes, better funding for research, *and* this national holiday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! They also proposed five modern equestrian complexes, better funding for research, and this national holiday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among other things, the deputies proposed establishing at least five modern equestrian complexes in the country, improving funding for horse breeding research institutes, and introducing a national holiday " Tulpar Day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] So the Prime Minister, Olzhas Bektenov, what did he say? Was he on board with all this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the Prime Minister, Olzhas Bektenov, what did he say? Was he on board with all this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: His official response said horse breeding *is* already part of state programs. And, like, over the past five years, they've allocated more than 9.4 billion tenge to support it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: His official response said horse breeding is already part of state programs. And, like, over the past five years, they've allocated more than nine point four billion tenge to support it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Prime Minister's response, horse breeding is included in Kazakhstan™s state programs for the development of the agro-industrial complex (AIC). Over the past five years, more than 9.4 billion tenge have been allocated from the budget to support this sector, including about 900 million tenge for the current year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's, uh, a lot of money! So, it sounds like they *are* supporting the industry. Do they really need a whole new holiday then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's, uh, a lot of money! So, it sounds like they are supporting the industry. Do they really need a whole new holiday then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He did remind everyone that the second Sunday of June is already "Livestock Breeders' Day," which covers horse specialists. Plus, July 11th is World Horse Day, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did remind everyone that the second Sunday of June is already "Livestock Breeders' Day," which covers horse specialists. Plus, July eleventh is World Horse Day, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Prime Minister also reminded that on the second Sunday of June, Kazakhstan celebrates the professional holiday " Livestock Breeders™ Day, which includes all workers in the livestock industry, including horse breeding specialists. Furthermore, according to a UN General Assembly resolution, July 11 is observed as World Horse Day in all UN member states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, yeah, the UN thing. So, it's not a done deal then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, yeah, the U N thing. So, it's not a done deal then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, he said the issue of introducing a special "Tulpar Day" will be "further considered." But the name itself, "Tulpar," that's where it gets interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, he said the issue of introducing a special "Tulpar Day" will be "further considered." But the name itself, "Tulpar," that's where it gets interesting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "In this regard, the issue of introducing a special national holiday " Tulpar Day " will be further considered," the government assured.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, what *is* a Tulpar? Sounds mythical.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, what is a Tulpar? Sounds mythical.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It totally is! It's this legendary winged or celestial horse in Turkic mythology, kind of like, you know, the Greek Pegasus. It's even on their national emblems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It totally is! It's this legendary winged or celestial horse in Turkic mythology, kind of like, you know, the Greek Pegasus. It's even on their national emblems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tulpar is a legendary winged or celestial horse in Turkic mythology, similar to the Greek Pegasus. This mythical creature is prominently depicted on the national emblems of Kazakhstan and Bashkortostan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's really cool! So, it's a symbol of national pride, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's really cool! So, it's a symbol of national pride, then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It comes from ancient Central Asian hunting traditions, where horses and birds of prey were, like, combined in people's imaginations. Pretty epic, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It comes from ancient Central Asian hunting traditions, where horses and birds of prey were, like, combined in people's imaginations. Pretty epic, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The origin of Tulpar is linked to the hunting traditions of Central Asian peoples, who used horses in combination with birds of prey. Over time, these two animals merged in the human imagination, creating the winged horse known as Tulpar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That’s a beautiful origin story for a holiday. I hope it gets approved!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a beautiful origin story for a holiday. I hope it gets approved!
